name: Léo BECHET
title: PhD student at Uppsala University
shortIntro: PhD student at Uppsala University, with a background in computational physics and artificial intelligence, I strive in creating custom solutions for any challenges.
longIntro:
Personal Introduction

Hello! I am Léo Bechet, a computational physicist and AI enthusiast with a strong passion for astronomy, optics, and computer science. Curious and analytical, I thrive on complex technical challenges and enjoy exploring interdisciplinary scientific problems. I am fluent in English (C1+) and French (native), with basic knowledge of Spanish and Japanese.

Professional Introduction

I hold a Master's degree in Computational Physics and am pursuing a PhD in energy-efficient algorithmic solutions. I specialize in computational physics, AI, and neural network development. My work blends scientific research with practical software development, including high-performance simulations, GPU programming, and hybrid neural network training methods.

Education

  • PhD – Energy-efficient algorithmic solutions driven by data-intensive applications, Uppsala University
  • Master 2 & Master 1 – Physics & Computational Physics, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • Bachelor – Fundamental Physics, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • Higher school preparatory classes – Physics-Chemistry & Engineering Science, Lycée Follereau

Research Experience

  • Hybrid Gradient Propagation via DFA-Seeding, System 7 Lab, Tokyo University
  • Stepper Motor-Based Laser Sweeping, FEMTO-ST
  • 3D Extinction Mapping of the Milky Way using ANN, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • Multidimensional Potential Energy Surfaces, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • Space Battle Around a Black Hole Simulation, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté

Projects

  • GPU/CPU Optimized N-Body Simulation
  • Conway’s Game of Life Stability Study
  • Strange Attractor Visualizer
  • Marching Cubes Algorithm Web Demo
  • Web-Based 3D Raycast Renderer

Skills & Focus Areas

  • Programming: Fortran, OpenMP, OpenACC, Python, JavaScript/HTML/CSS, NodeJS, C#, C, Bash, GLSL/HLSL
  • Frameworks & Tools: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Jupyter, LaTeX, Docker, Fusion 360
  • Numerical & Physical Simulations, Embedded Systems, Server Administration

Interests

  • Astronomy & Astrophotography
  • Optics and Experimental Chemistry
  • Procedural Simulations & AI Research
  • Photography, Image Processing, and Computer Graphics

projects.name: FeatherPress
projects.shortDescription: A lightweight Node.js server designed to serve Markdown files as HTML web pages, featuring template injection, category indexes, syntax highlighting, LaTeX support, and flexible content organization.

projects.name: Cellular Automata
projects.shortDescription: A Python-based implementation of multiple Cellular Automata. The system supports CUDA kernels and implements hardware acceleration using GPU.

projects.name: Monte Carlon Rate-Equations
projects.shortDescription: A high-performance Python simulation of particle aggregation using Numba for parallel processing. Features a custom multi-pass grid update and analysis with DFS and parallel Union-Find.

projects.name: N-Body using Fortran OpenMP and OpenACC
projects.shortDescription: A high-performance Fortan N-Body simulation. The project contains a single threaded, a multi-threaded CPU OpenMP, and an OpenACC GPU approaches. Results can be verified using the conservation of energy.

projects.name: AI-Powered Logistics Optimizer
projects.shortDescription: Reduced shipping costs by 18% through a predictive routing algorithm.
